intro: Thliphthisa antalyensis, commonly known as the Antalya thliphthisa, is a rare flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
